SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.utils

Class ItemCollection

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.utils.ItemCollection
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class ItemCollection extends Object implements Serializable
ItemCollection is class that allows to store information about amounts of items. With item we intend every object of the Corner enum class, except Corner.EMPTY, which represents the concept of "missing item", counting this kind of Corner is not useful nor reasonable for this application. The class allows the user to perform set operations with ItemCollection and Corner types. Storing capabilities become particularly useful when dealing with players' inventories or cards' resource constraint and when moving amounts of items around (collecting resources from placed cards for instance). Set operations allow goals and scoring evaluation methods to become simple to write, read and understand.

Example: 


  // Creating a new empty ItemCollection
  ItemCollection collection = new ItemCollection();

  // Adding 3 PLANTs, 1 ANIMAL and 2 FEATHERS to the ItemCollection
  collection.add(Corner.PLANT, 3)
            .add(Corner.ANIMAL)
            .add(Corner.FEATHER, 2);

  // Asking the ItemCollection how many PLANTs were stored (3)
  int plantCount = collection.count(Corner.PLANT);

  // Removing 2 PLANTs and 1 ANIMAL from the ItemCollection
  collection.sub(Corner.PLANT, 2)
            .sub(Corner.ANIMAL);
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ItemCollection

      public ItemCollection()
      Constructs a new empty ItemColletion. The new object will have every amount (re)set to zero.

    • ItemCollection

      public ItemCollection(ItemCollection itemCollection)
      Constructs a new ItemColletion starting from an existing one. The new object will have the same initial amounts but will evolve independently from the passed ItemCollection.
      Parameters:
      itemCollection - the ItemCollection upon which the new object will be created

  • Method Details

    • add

      public ItemCollection add(ItemCollection itemCollection)
      Adds the amounts of items from the given ItemCollection to this one and then returns the current ItemCollection to allow method chaining.
      Parameters:
      itemCollection - the ItemCollection whose amounts are added
      Returns:
      this ItemCollection after the operation

    • add

      public ItemCollection add(Corner corner)
      Increases the amount of the given corner's item by one and then returns the current ItemCollection to allow method chaining.
      Parameters:
      corner - the Corner whose item's count needs to be increased by 1
      Returns:
      this ItemCollection after the operation

    • add

      public ItemCollection add(Corner corner, int amount)
      Increases the stored amount of the specified corner by the selected value's item and then returns the current ItemCollection to allow method chaining.
      Parameters:
      corner - the Corner whose item's count needs to be increased
      amount - the value to add to the amount of the given corner's item
      Returns:
      this ItemCollection after the operation

    • sub

      public ItemCollection sub(ItemCollection itemCollection)
      Subtracts the amounts of items in the given ItemCollection from this one and then returns the current ItemCollection to allow method chaining.
      Parameters:
      itemCollection - the ItemCollection whose amounts are subtracted
      Returns:
      this ItemCollection after the operation

    • sub

      public ItemCollection sub(Corner corner)
      Decreases the stored amount of the specified corner's item by one and then returns the current ItemCollection to allow method chaining.
      Parameters:
      corner - the Corner whose item's count needs to be decreased by 1
      Returns:
      this ItemCollection after the operation

    • sub

      public ItemCollection sub(Corner corner, int amount)
      Decreases the stored amount of the specified corner's item by the selected value and then returns the current ItemCollection to allow method chaining.
      Parameters:
      corner - the Corner whose item's count needs to be decreased
      amount - the value to subtract from the amount of the given corner's item
      Returns:
      this ItemCollection after the operation

    • isSubSetOf

      public boolean isSubSetOf(ItemCollection itemCollection)
      Checks whether the current ItemCollection is a subset of the given ItemCollection. Basically, it checks if, for every item, the amount in the current ItemCollection are always less than or equal to the amount in the given ItemCollection.
      Parameters:
      itemCollection - the ItemCollection to compare the current one against
      Returns:
      true if this ItemCollection is a subset of given one, false otherwise

    • divide

      public int divide(ItemCollection itemCollection)
      Computes how many times the given ItemCollection could be subtracted from the current one before any amount becomes negative. In other words, it computes the maximum number of partition of the current ItemCollection that are equal to the given ItemCollection.

      Both definitions suggest that trying to perform this operation when given an empty ItemCollection (amount = 0 for every item) has an undefined result.

      This result is also represented by the smallest integer division between amounts (this amount / given amount) of item whose amounts in the given (divisor) ItemCollection isn't zero.

      Parameters:
      itemCollection - the divisor ItemCollection
      Returns:
      times given ItemCollection is found in this ItemCollection
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - if the given divisor ItemCollection is empty

    • count

      public int count(Corner corner)
      Returns the amount of a specific Corner's item in this ItemCollection.
      Parameters:
      corner - Corner whose item we want to know the amount stored
      Returns:
      the amount of the specified Corner's Item in this ItemCollection
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the specified Corner is null
      NoSuchElementException - if the specified Corner is Corner.EMPTY thus a "missing item"

    • toList

      public List<Corner> toList()
      Retrieves the ItemCollection content as a list of Corners. Each Corner amounts in the list matches the amounts in the ItemCollection
      Returns:
      a List containing the ItemCollection's content

      public String toString()
